bug.author: ZoranPandovski
bug.summary: Installation issues on Windows with Python 3.8.5
bug.description: There is a torch installation issue when installing MindsDB on Windows with Python 3.8.5 version. We need to check if pytorch supports that version on Windows and if not include that in python_requires.

comments.comment: I used the method provided in the readme and had the issue initially. But it seems after re-install it went away. Here's the version i'm running locally Requirement already satisfied: torch>=1.1.0 in ... (from flair>=0.5->mindsdb-native==2.13.0->mindsdb) (1.4.0+cpu)

Hey, I've recently installed PyTorch on windows with python 3.8 and cudatoolkit 10.2. I found no issues in the installation. Could you elaborate more about the issue you are facing or maybe some error logs?
Thanks, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Kshitij09>@Kshitij09</denchmark-link> . This is working now. We would be really happy if you contribute to MindsDB, please follow our backlog issues
Sure! Just found these open issues doable so commented on them. Will have a look at the backlog issues now.
Sure! Just found these open issues doable so commented on them. Will have a look at the backlog issues now.
